data.title: Craig Ferguson On Filming Then Came You [Exclusive Interview]
data.meta_description: Craig Ferguson brings his charismatic personality in the new film Then Came You. Starring Kathie Lee Gifford and Elizabeth Hurley.
data.text:
Craig Ferguson brings his charismatic personality in the new film Then Came You. A screenplay by Kathie Lee Gifford.

Here’s the synopsis of the film:

Then Came You stars Kathie Lee Gifford as a lonely widow who plans a trip around the world with her husband’s ashes, to visit the places they loved in the movies. During her first stop in Scotland at the beautiful estate she stays in, she meets the innkeeper who changes her life forever.

ALSO READ: Helstrom: Elizabeth Marvel Talks Playing The Matriarch In New Hulu Series [Exclusive Interview]

Craig Ferguson is best known for hosting “The Late Late Show With Craig Ferguson” for an entire decade. His talent has also spread as a comedian, writer and once a drummer. His first taste of the entertainment industry was while playing with punk bands in the U.K. During his career he has also written featured films like The Big Tease and Saving Grace. Including his directorial debut with I’ll Be There. Ferguson made a return for the third installment of How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World to voice his character, Gobber. The Emmy Award-winning actor released his third book, Elephant: A Memoir of Altercations, Humiliations, Hallucinations, and Observations.

I had the opportunity to speak with Craig Ferguson about Then Came You. He shared what it was like to work with talented ladies and shared a key to happiness.

Then Came You is available on Demand
